Night Shift sighs in relief.  It was a near miss, but he was fortunate enou=
gh that he had the fuel and the rubber to make it to a somewhat safe zone.
=

"Talk about burn'n rubber, so not the way I intended ta do that.  You okay=
 Rat Trap?"

Rat Trap coughs a bit.

"Yeah, I'm okay.  Ughh, I hate that sm=
ell, worse than what comes outa Quickstride's tail end... So ya got all fou=
r of your wheels, I hope? Because if ya blew any of your tires, we're done =
for."

Night Shift checks his tire pressures.

"Got 'em all, lucky for me. =
 Everything's fine, we still got enough gas, and I'm pickn' up a small fain=
t Unicronian signature.  It's ahead of us."

Rat Trap looks to the fuel gau=
ge.

" Whew, you still got almost a full tank of gas.  But I thought ya jus=
t filled up back at the Ark..  Gee, whatever vehicle alt form ya chose, sur=
e eats up a lotta gas."

Night Shift continues the trek.

" V6 engine, all =
wheel drive, yeah, I know.  Heey, still doesn't eat up as much fuel as a De=
cepticon Seeker does.  They go through gas within astroseconds."

Rat Trap =
cocks his head in confusion.

" I - wouldn't know that because till now, we=
 really hadn't known much about Decepticons."

Night Shift chuckles. Keepin=
g the mood a little lighter seemed to help them both along easier.

" It's =
true, those engines are big, and the bigger the engine, the more fuel it's =
apt ta use.  And they got several engines instead of just one, like me."

R=
at Trap listens curiously.

"Oh, that explains it.  Yeah, you're right, two=
 engines would use up more gas. So, think we'll be able ta find Cheetor?"

=
Night Shift sighs.

"I hope so."

and

r like

t as he moved like seom
> boiling red wave, but so far he was able to keep =
ahead of it. As the ground
> began to level out the speed that the liquid r=
ock moved was beginning to
> slow.

 scan for Unicronian energy signatures,

ould seem that their quarry had escaped
> them for the moment.

> Meanwhi=
le ahead of them were the remains of a small forest. It was here that
> the=
 Magma was coming to a stop as they were coming to the fringes of the

ken landscape, the forest a victim of the ravages from the initial

t from the now distant volcano. The leaves and brush of this forest

een all burnt away but the trees still remained, looking much like

matchsticks all facing skyward. There did not appear to be any signs

iological life.

hift was able to pick

just ahead. It was

oods!
